alert.note: Alert for Clark; Scotland (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 15 at 8:38PM CST until February 17 at 6:00PM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Freezing rain and sleet turning to all snow. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches and ice accumulations of up to one tenth of an inch possible. Winds could gust as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Missouri, southeast Iowa and north central, northwest and west central Illinois. * WHEN...From late Wednesday night through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel may become hazardous due to snow and ice covered roads and at times very low visibility. This will affect both the Thursday morning and afternoon commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heavy rates of snowfall greater than one inch per hour are possible. This combined with winds gusting as high as 35 mph could result hazardous travel conditions.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
